rows.text_1: Let’s look at an example together. @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name is spending too much time watching TV before her homework is finished. @data.characters.f1_mother.name helps him create a family rule about this:

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “It is important that you get your homework done so you can do well in school. Let’s make a rule about watching TV so that you have enough time for homework, too.”
@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Okay, Mum.”

@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “What do you think would be a fair rule?”
@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Hmmm…well, maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework?”

@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “I like that idea, but let’s limit it to 30 minutes per day so that you have time for other fun and relaxing things too. How does that sound?”
@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Fine.”

@data.characters.f1_mother.name: “Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name. Last night you mentioned that your math tests have become easier for you! I am proud of you! We can increase your time to an hour each day… as long as you still do your homework first!”
@data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name: “Thank you, Mum!”

rows.text_1: Let’s reflect on how @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name created a rule together.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.
rows.quiz_1_option_4_text: To make sure she feels the rule is fair and realistic
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Correct. When you make rules together with your child, the rules will work better.
rows.quiz_2_question: What does @data.characters.f1_mother.name do when @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name follows the rule?
rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: Yes, by doing this @data.characters.f1_mother.name makes it more likely that @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name will keep following the rule about TV watching.

rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: Yes, by doing this @data.characters.f1_mother.name makes it more likely that @data.characters.f1_daughter_6.name will keep following the rules about TV watching.

rows.text_1: Let’s look at another family. They have set up a routine around bedtime that is working really well!

rows.text_2:
@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “I am so happy to see you playing quietly with your blocks, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. In 5 minutes, it will be time to get ready for bed. When you are ready for bed, we can read a story together.”

 @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Okay!”

*5 minutes later*

 @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “Time to get ready for bed, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. First, let’s get you nice and clean with a bath.”
@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “You were so well-behaved in the bath, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name. Now it is time to put your pyjamas on.”

@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “Well done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name! Now let’s brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!”

@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “You did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have time to read a story. Which book would you like to read?”

 @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Yay! Can you read me the story about the lion?”

@data.characters.f2_grandmother.name: “ “The end….” I’m glad you chose that story for us to read, it’s one of my favourites! Goodnight, my baby girl. I love you very much.”

 @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name: “Goodnight, @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name.”

rows.text_1: Let’s think about what made this routine work well so we can all have peaceful bedtimes in our families.
rows.quiz_1_question: How often do you think @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name follow this routine?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Try again. If @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name only do these steps once a week, @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name would not be able to remember and follow the routine as well as she does here.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Try again. Following these steps only a few times a week may confuse @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, and she may struggle to follow the routine as well as she does here.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3:
Exactly. Being consistent with a routine – especially at the end of the day when everyone is tired – makes activities easier to follow for children. 

With a bit of practice, bedtime can become a happy time of connecting with your child!
rows.quiz_2_question: What does @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name do to help @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name follow this routine?
rows.quiz_2_option_1_text: She praises and connects with @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name before giving instructions
rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: Yes, praise helps encourage @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.
rows.quiz_2_option_2_text: She promises @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name a simple reward to encourage her
rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: Yes, the promise of a reward helped @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.
rows.quiz_2_option_3_text: She gives @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name a transition warning for each step of the routine.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: Yes, knowing which step comes next helps @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to follow the routine successfully.
rows.quiz_2_option_4_text: She gives @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name one instruction at a time.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_4: Yes, one instruction at a time means @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name doesn’t get confused and helps her to follow the routine successfully.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_5: Yes, praise will help @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name to remember how to follow the routine successfully next time, and encourage her to follow the next step.
